title: Suzie Lightfoot almost loses her beloved labradoodle Ruby after it ate poisoned bait in Brisbane
text:
A popular Brisbane socialite has revealed her beloved labradoodle almost died after eating a meatball laced with poison.

Former model Suzie Lightfoot, 53, was taking her dog Ruby for a nightly walk near her home in Hawthorne when she spotted something on the nature strip.

She started to panic when Ruby picked the suspicious ball of meat from the ground and started chewing it.

'I quickly put my fingers in her mouth but she'd already eaten most of it,' she told the Courier Mail.

'What kind of creature does this to innocent pets?'

Suzie Lightfoot almost lost her labradoodle Ruby (pictured) when it ate a poisoned meatball

Ms Lightfoot, who was a prominent model in the 1990s, rushed Ruby to get treatment.

Ruby was at Animal Emergency Service in Underwood for hours and had to have her stomach pumped.

Ms Lighfoot said the situation could have easily gone the other way.

The following day Ms Lightfoot found a 'perfectly round' rissole the size of a 50 cent coin in the same place.

She took the piece of meat to her local vet to be tested for poison.

Ms Lightfoot said the incident had left her and long-term partner Craig Green with thousands of dollars worth of emergency vet bills.

She had to pay thousands of dollars in vet bills to have her dog's stomach pumped

Another dog - a border collie - has also been the victim of a suspected baiting in the area.

'We have a tight-knit community but it is so hard to feel safe, and everyone is anxious all the time – it takes the freedom out of walking with your dog because you're constantly on alert,' she said.

In August, panic was sparked in the Newstead's Waterfront Park and New Farm Park area after two dogs believed to have died after being baitedMeat was found scattered around both parks, and RSPCA Queensland's Michael Beatty said at the time the appearance of the baiting being indiscriminate was concerning.
description: Popular Brisbane socialite Suzie Lightfoot, 53, has revealed her beloved labradoodle almost died after eating a meatball laced with poison.
authors: Claudia Poposki For Daily Mail Australia
